metadata.title: BDA Departments: Statutory Functions vs Performance
metadata.description: Analysis of BDA departments, their responsibilities under the BDA Act 1976, and actual performance
metadata.act_reference: Bangalore Development Authority Act, 1976 (Karnataka Act 12 of 1976)
metadata.jurisdiction_note: As of 2025, BDA jurisdiction reduced from 1,294 km² to 582 km² with Greater Bengaluru Authority (GBA) taking over 712 km² of Bengaluru City

statutory_functions.function: Prepare and revise Comprehensive Development Plans
statutory_functions.description: Draw up detailed schemes for development of Bangalore Metropolitan Area
Regulate layout formation and private street creation, approve site layouts with required civic amenities
Prepare comprehensive development plans for peripheral areas of BMA
Ensure minimum 15% for parks/playgrounds and 10% for civic amenities in all layouts

master_plans.reason: To integrate Transit Oriented Development (TOD) Policy

master_plans.notes: After jurisdiction reduction to peripheral areas only

recent_achievements.achievement: Government approval for 6 new layouts along Peripheral Ring Road 2
recent_achievements.impact: Large-scale residential development in peripheral areas

recent_achievements.achievement: Land acquisition for major residential hubs

strengths: Aggressive land acquisition for future development (2025)
Integration of modern concepts like TOD
weaknesses: RMP 2031 withdrawn without replacement for 5+ years
Master Plan 2041 tender floated decades after RMP 2015
Declining layout approvals (287 in 1990s vs 86 in 2020s)

statutory_functions.description: Provide drainage, water supply, electricity, street construction/reconstruction in development schemes
Undertake developmental schemes and infrastructure works with government approval
Construct and maintain streets, drainage, and lighting in BDA layouts
Carry out building, engineering and other operations necessary for development

strengths: Large-scale infrastructure planning for new layouts
weaknesses: Limited public data on infrastructure delivery timelines
No published statistics on project completion rates
Infrastructure backlog in older layouts

statutory_functions.description: Allot residential and commercial sites developed by BDA to eligible applicants
Collect rents, sales proceeds, property taxes and betterment tax for the BDA Fund
Manage and dispose of moveable and immoveable property
Levy and collect betterment tax (one-third of value increase) from benefited properties

revenue_data.note: Detailed revenue figures not publicly available

strengths: 800+ civic amenity sites for public utilities
weaknesses: No transparent allotment data for recent years
Revenue collection efficiency data not published
Long waiting lists for site allotment

statutory_functions.description: Handle lawsuits filed by and against BDA in various courts
Manage legal procedures for land acquisition by agreement or compulsion
Ensure legal vesting of acquired land in BDA, free from encumbrances
Legal enforcement of building and construction regulations

strengths: Managed legal processes for 1,000+ layout developments
weaknesses: No public data on litigation outcomes
Transparency lacking in land acquisition disputes
Case pendency data not published

statutory_functions.description: Handle media relations, press releases, public announcements
Process public queries and route them to respective departments
Provide information to citizens and ensure transparency

strengths: Multiple web domains for public access
weaknesses: Website redirects causing confusion
Limited real-time grievance tracking
Performance metrics not regularly published

statutory_functions.function: Issue Transfer of Development Rights Certificates
statutory_functions.description: Manage and issue TDR certificates for surrendered land or development rights
Assess property values and value increases due to BDA development

weaknesses: No public data on TDR issuance
Transparency lacking in valuation processes

statutory_functions.description: Manage fund credited with property rents, sales, loans, taxes, and betterment charges
Maintain accounts, prepare budgets, ensure proper fund utilization
Prepare annual budgets for development operations and administrative costs

weaknesses: Budget data not easily accessible to public
Revenue and expenditure details not published online
Financial transparency limited

statutory_compliance.explanation: BDA fulfills core statutory functions of planning and layout development but faces gaps in transparency, data publication, and timely master plan updates

performance_highlights: 1,017 layouts approved since 1972 - comprehensive spatial development
76,000 residential sites allotted - significant housing provision
18,000+ acres land acquisition in 2025 - proactive future planning
Integration of modern concepts (TOD, peripheral development)
critical_gaps: Master Plan delay: RMP 2031 withdrawn (2020), RMP 2041 tender only in 2025
Limited transparency: Most performance metrics not publicly available
Data publication: Revenue, infrastructure delivery, litigation data not disclosed
Jurisdiction reduction: 2025 reduction to 582 km² raises questions about future role
recommendations: Accelerate Master Plan 2041 preparation and approval
Publish annual performance dashboards with key metrics
Improve transparency in revenue collection and fund utilization
Digitize grievance redressal with real-time tracking
Clarify role and functions post-GBA formation
